image.altText: A still frame of a video uses graphics to highlight two specific weapons

props.synopsis: A month before a massacre in Papua New Guinea's highlands, videos emerged of the high-powered weapons tribes in the region now have in their possession.

title.children: US and Australian guns meant to keep the peace now in the hands of PNG warlords

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a business jacket poses for a photo inside a modern building.

props.synopsis: There are calls for a specialised crimes unit following revelations in a Four Corners and Guardian Australia investigation.

title.children: Australia urged to do more to investigate alleged genocide perpetrators in the country

image.altText: A wounded Palestinian man lies on a cart as Palestinians gather to wait for trucks carrying bags of flour to arrive.

props.synopsis: Health authorities in Gaza claim Israeli troops opened fire on people waiting for aid near Gaza City, reportedly killing more than 100 Palestinians and wounded hundreds more.

title.children: Gaza authorities say Israeli troops opened fire near aid trucks, IDF says trampling happened

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair, face mask and sunglasses walks out of glass sliding doors with family members on either side of her.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide mother has been sentenced to four-and-a-half years on home detention for criminally neglecting her three-week-old son, who was allegedly killed by his father in April 2021. Warning: This story contains details that may be distressing for some readers.

title.children: Mother-of-two who pleaded guilty to criminal neglect after death of infant son sentenced to home detention

image.altText: Malaysian mother and daughter standing together.

props.synopsis: The family of Adelaide grandmother Anna Jenkins, whose remains were found on a construction site in Malaysia, has called on the Australian government to make representations to Malaysia on the family's behalf.

title.children: Anna Jenkins's family calls on Australian government to intervene in Malaysia court dispute

image.altText: A composite image of Robert and Malcolm Cole

props.synopsis: Malcolm Cole was Indigenous and gay. He later died from HIV but in 1988 he created a "stirring" moment at Sydney's Mardi Gras and now his twin brother is determined to make sure his legacy lives on.

title.children: A Black Captain Cook will be at Mardi Gras in 2024 to celebrate a life cut far too short

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: A head and shoulders shot of Australian coronavirus victim James Kwan smiling outdoors and waving a hand in the air.

props.synopsis: When James Kwan became the first Australian casualty from the virus in 2020, it was only weeks later his beloved tourism industry was brought to its knees.

title.children: Four years after a tourism stalwart's death from COVID-19, how is his beloved industry recovering?

image.altText: Dozens of high school boys students, in uniform, in a grandstand, cheering on their rugby team.

props.synopsis: With several single-sex schools announcing they'll go co-ed in coming years, the debate about whether gendered schooling is better for your children has again reared its head. We ask education experts, advocates and a neurologist to break down the evidence.

title.children: With more single-sex schools going co-ed, what is the evidence for gender-segregated education?

image.altText: Taylor Swift sings into a microphone on stage in Sydney while dressed in a sequin bodysuit.

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of Swifties are flying into Singapore over the next week because of a deal the city-state government struck to be the only South-East Asia country to host Taylor Swift.

title.children: Taylor Swift was paid a bonus to make Singapore her only South-East Asia stop. This is how super concerts can get political

image.altText: Dark storm clouds swallow blue sunlit skies

props.synopsis: Australia has closed the curtain on a wet, hot and muggy summer that saw "a bit of everything" — ranking as the third warmest overall, and third wettest for an El Niño year. See how your city fared.

title.children: That's a wrap for a weird summer with rain and heat on steroids: Get your questions in now with our experts

image.altText: An illustration of a male prisoner sitting in a Russian cell.

props.synopsis: After the still-unexplained death of Alexei Navalny at an Arctic penal colony this month, human rights advocates warn that Russia's political prisoners face an increased risk of dying in "slow motion" under severe conditions.

title.children: What life is like inside Russia's brutal prison system

image.altText: A person holding a phone displaying the Facebook Marketplace logo

props.synopsis: Exclusive data from the NAB shows customer reports of buying and selling scams spiked in the final quarter of 2023, with most occurring through online marketplaces and social media.

title.children: Facebook Marketplace dominates reports of online buying scams and data shows the problem is getting worse

image.altText: lipstick

props.synopsis: There are renewed warnings of dark clouds hanging over the Australian economy. And the former boss of an upmarket department store says those warnings have been reinforced by the increase in sales of lipstick.

title.children: The ominous reason lipstick sales are up, according to one former department store boss

image.altText: A sign on brown paper in a cafe window reads: We're hiring staff, looking for hospo all rounders

props.synopsis: Productivity tumbled in 2022-23 after a pandemic sugar hit, in part because of a surge in hours worked.

title.children: Productivity falls back to earth after pandemic sugar hit

image.altText: Sandwhich boards with political candidates Jodie Belyea and Nathan Conroy

props.synopsis: On the eve of the Dunkley by-election, the ABC spoke to candidates and voters ahead of what commentators on both sides expect to be a tight contest.

title.children: Tomorrow's Dunkley by-election is a test for both Albanese and Dutton. These are the issues on voters' minds

image.altText: Anne Berthelsen using menopause medication

props.synopsis: From full body aches and pains to burning hot flushes and wild, anxious mood swings, the twists and turns Anne Berthelsen-Murray's body takes through the worst of menopause are no trivial annoyance.

title.children: Women 'tearing their hair out' amid continuing global shortage of vital menopause medication

image.altText: A woman wearing a headband and blue dress looks at the camera and is surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Growing up, June Oscar heard racial slurs in the playground. Decades later, she says it's disturbing that such language continues to be used.

title.children: Racism within the police force is not isolated to the NT, says social justice commissioner

image.altText: Alcor Life Extension Foundation cryogenic chambers.

props.synopsis: Li Zehou was a leading light of the Chinese aesthetics movement in the 1980s, but after he died in 2010, his final wish was to have his brain frozen in the hopes of proving his biggest theory.

title.children: Li Zehou's brain advanced Chinese philosophy, but now it's frozen in a vat in Arizona

image.altText: A blue EV model from Chinese brand BYD.

props.synopsis: The United States is opening an investigation and could impose restrictions on Chinese vehicles due to concerns about "connected" car technology.

title.children: 'Risks to our national security': White House to investigate national security data risks from Chinese vehicles

image.altText: A bald man with a white beard and red top sits at a table.

props.synopsis: John Lowe's "tiny one-bedroom residence" is all he needs — and all he can afford — but he and other long-term residents of a northern Tasmanian caravan park are worried they'll be evicted as a result of a council crackdown.

title.children: 'They're not rich people': Caravan park residents told their homes may be 'non-compliant', and they'll have to go

image.altText: A bald police officer speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: A former immigration detainee has had sex offence charges against him dropped, after being wrongly identified as being involved in two assaults in Melbourne.

title.children: Victoria Police 'sincerely sorry' for bungle after ex-detainee's sex offence charges dropped

image.altText: A graphic showing a vial of the Mounjaro weight loss drug next to three Ozempic pens

props.synopsis: The Therapeutic Goods Administration will move to ban compounding pharmacists from making their own versions of injectable weight loss drugs due to concerns the compounded products may not be safe or effective.

title.children: Authorities move to stop pharmacies making copycat Ozempic over safety concerns

image.altText: Fisherman Darcy Fazio stares down lense of camera

props.synopsis: Queensland's fishers say the state's new gillnet restrictions — aimed at ensuring protected species aren't caught — are so onerous they are risking their own lives.

title.children: New fishing regulations will cost Darcy his job but he never expected them to almost cost him his life

image.altText: Celeste Manno.

props.synopsis: Luay Sako has been jailed for 36 years for obsessively stalking and killing Celeste Manno, but the victim's mother believes the punishment does not go far enough.

title.children: Grieving mother slams 'outrageous' sentence as Celeste Manno's murderer avoids life in jail

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin delivers his annual address.

props.synopsis: Mr Putin has previously spoken of the dangers of a direct confrontation between NATO and Russia, but his nuclear warning on Thursday is one of his most explicit.

title.children: Putin warns West of risk of nuclear war during annual address, says Moscow can strike Western targets

image.altText: A man with his back to camera facing out of a large window.

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic spy agency has revealed a retired politician betrayed the nation, but stopped short of naming them. Here's what we know, and what might happen next.

title.children: Revelations of a 'traitor' politician have sent a rocket up parliament. Here's what we know

image.altText: Brisbane inner city suburbs rooftops solar panels

props.synopsis: Australia has gone from virtually no household solar installations 15 years ago to more than 3 million today, so the idea regulators should make it harder to install panels seems baffling.

title.children: Victorians facing record low returns from rooftop solar, but will that slow the juggernaut?

image.altText: Two Palestinian boys play next to to Jewish girls at lunchtime in the school yard.

props.synopsis: Known in Arabic as Wahat al-Salaam and in Hebrew as Neve Shalom, Israel's only community shared intentionally between Jews and Palestinians hopes to show the wider world that a shared society is possible.

title.children: Inside 'the dream' where Israelis and Palestinians live together harmoniously, even as war rages on

image.altText: The outside of the Toowoomba Court

props.synopsis: The man, who the court heard considered himself "the worst kind of feral pig there is", started abusing his daughter when she was aged four. She was 15 when it ended.

title.children: Queensland man jailed after raping own daughter 'every second day' for 11 years

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a suit stands for the camera.

props.synopsis: A former politician was cultivated by spies, Australian intelligence has revealed, and former treasurer Joe Hockey says every politician's loyalty will be questioned until that "traitor" is named.

title.children: Unnamed 'traitor' politician cultivated by spies puts loyalty of all politicians in question, says former treasurer

image.altText: A man and woman look at each other with the blue mountains in the background

props.synopsis: Paul and Julia Bamforth will spend decades behind bars after sexually abusing a child in their Narara home over a five-year period.

title.children: Married NSW couple receive 30-year sentences after lengthy abuse of a child with cognitive impairment

image.altText: A middle-aged man with grey hair and glasses standing near a police car.

props.synopsis: Ian Frank Bartholomew's neighbour says his actions left her feeling like a prisoner in her own home. The 58-year-old, who will be sentenced tomorrow, told reporters he intends to make a video about the court hearing.

title.children: TikTok star who danced with sex doll outside woman's home pleads guilty to stalking

image.altText: A photo of a white submersible under water.

props.synopsis: A new clip from an upcoming documentary on the Titan submersible disaster includes never before heard audio of 'knocking' picked up by search and rescue crews.

title.children: Banging sound from Titan submersible search heard for first time in UK documentary

props.synopsis: The owners of the Crooked House, which was demolished after a fire gutted it last year, have been ordered to rebuild it, but can it be returned to its former glory?

title.children: Owners of 200-year-old wonky pub in England ordered to rebuild it brick-by-brick
